org.dyn4j.geometry

Interface Shape

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Transformable
    All Known Subinterfaces:
    Convex
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractShape, Capsule, Circle, Ellipse, HalfEllipse, Polygon, Rectangle, Segment, Slice, Triangle, Wound

    public interface Shape
extends Transformable
    Represents a geometric Shape.

    Shapes are Transformable, however, in general a Transform object should be used instead of directly transforming the Shape. Doing so will allow reuse of the same Shape object in multiple places, where only the Transform differs.

    Since:
    1.0.0
    Version:
    3.1.4
    Author:
    William Bittle

      • rotateAboutCenter

        void rotateAboutCenter(double theta)
        Rotates the Shape about it's center.

        This method replaced the overriding functionality of the rotate method from the Transformable interface.

        Parameters:
        theta - the rotation angle in radians
        Since:
        3.1.1

      • project

        Interval project(Vector2 n)
        Returns the Interval of this Shape projected onto the given Vector2 given the Transform.

        This is the same as calling project(Vector2, Transform) and passing Transform.IDENTITY.

        Parameters:
        n - Vector2 to project onto
        Returns:
        Interval
        Since:
        3.1.5

      • project

        Interval project(Vector2 n,
               Transform transform)
        Returns the Interval of this Shape projected onto the given Vector2 given the Transform.
        Parameters:
        n - Vector2 to project onto
        transform - Transform for this Shape
        Returns:
        Interval

      • contains

        boolean contains(Vector2 point)
        Returns true if the given point is inside this Shape.

        If the given point lies on an edge the point is considered to be inside the Shape.

        The given point is assumed to be in world space.

        This is the same as calling contains(Vector2, Transform) and passing Transform.IDENTITY.

        Parameters:
        point - world space point
        Returns:
        boolean
        Since:
        3.1.5

      • contains

        boolean contains(Vector2 point,
               Transform transform)
        Returns true if the given point is inside this Shape.

        If the given point lies on an edge the point is considered to be inside the Shape.

        The given point is assumed to be in world space.

        Parameters:
        point - world space point
        transform - Transform for this Shape
        Returns:
        boolean

      • createMass

        Mass createMass(double density)
        Creates a Mass object using the geometric properties of this Shape and the given density.
        Parameters:
        density - the density in kg/m2
        Returns:
        Mass the Mass of this Shape

      • createAABB

        AABB createAABB()
        Creates an AABB from this Shape.

        This is the same as calling createAABB(Transform) and passing Transform.IDENTITY.

        Returns:
        AABB the AABB enclosing this Shape
        Since:
        3.1.4
